metadata.Title: CVE-2017-2615 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Quick emulator (QEMU) built with the Cirrus CLGD 54xx VGA emulator supportis vulnerable to an out-of-bounds access issue. It could occur whilecopying VGA data via bitblt copy in backward mode. A privileged user insidea guest could use this flaw to crash the QEMU process resulting in DoS orpotentially execute arbitrary code on the host with privileges of QEMUprocess on the host.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-2615` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-guest-agent - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-keymaps - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-kvm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-system - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-system-aarch64 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-system-arm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-system-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-system-mips - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-system-misc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-system-ppc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-system-sparc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-system-x86 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-user - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-user-static - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-utils - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
No subscription required

libxen-4.4 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.11
libxen-ocaml - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.11
libxenstore3.0 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.11

criterions.comment: qemu package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33').
xen package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.11').
